verses.text: and he shall slaughter the first bird over fresh water on a clay vessel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he shall take the cedar wood and the hyssop and the crimson thread and the living bird, and he shall dip them in the slaughtered bird’s blood and in the fresh water, and he shall spatter them on the house seven times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus he shall purify the house with the bird’s blood and with the fresh water and with the living bird and with the cedar wood and with the hyssop and with the crimson thread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall send the living bird outside the city into the open field; and so he shall make atonement for the house, and it shall be clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is the instruction for any infectious skin disease and for the diseased area of skin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for a mildew of the garment and for the house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the swelling and for the epidermal eruption and for the spot,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to teach when something is unclean and when something is clean. This is the regulation of the infectious skin disease.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the Israelites, and you shall say to them, ‘Any man when a fluid discharge occurs from his body, his fluid discharge is unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this becomes his uncleanness in his fluid discharge: whether his body secretes his fluid discharge or his body blocks his fluid discharge, it is his uncleanness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Any bed upon which the person who discharges lies down becomes unclean, and any object upon which he sits becomes unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And anyone who touches his bed must wash his garments and shall wash himself with water, and he shall be unclean until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the person who sits on the object upon which the person who discharges has sat must wash his garments, and he shall wash himself with water, and he shall be unclean until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the person who touches the body of the person who discharges must wash his garments, and he shall wash himself with water, and he shall be unclean until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if the person who discharges spits on one who is clean, then that one shall wash is garments, and he shall wash himself with water, and he shall be unclean until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And any saddle upon which the person who discharges rides becomes unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And any person who touches anything that happened to be under him becomes unclean until the evening, and the person who carries them must wash his garments, and he shall wash himself with water, and he shall be unclean until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And anyone whom the person who discharges might touch without rinsing off his hands with water shall wash his garments, and he shall wash himself with water, and he shall be unclean until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a clay vessel that the person who discharges touches must be broken, and any wood object must be rinsed with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And when the person who discharges becomes clean from his body fluid discharge, he shall count for himself seven days for his cleansing; then he shall wash his garments, and he shall wash his body with fresh water, and he shall be clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then on the eighth day he shall take for himself two turtledoves or two young doves, and he shall come before Yahweh at the tent of assembly’s entrance, and he shall give them to the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest shall sacrifice one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering, and so the priest shall make atonement for him before Yahweh from his body fluid discharge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And if an emission of semen goes out from anyone, then he shall wash all of his body with water, and he shall be unclean until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And any garment and anything leather on which is an emission of semen shall be washed with water, and it shall be unclean until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If there is a woman with whom a man lies down and there is an emission of semen, then they shall wash themselves with water, and they shall be unclean until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And when a woman is menstruating, her body fluid discharge occurs in her body; for seven days she shall be in her menstruation, and any person who touches her shall become unclean until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And anything upon which she lies down during her menstruation shall become unclean, and anything upon which she sits shall become unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And any person who touches her bed must wash his garments, and he shall wash himself with water, and he shall be unclean until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And any person who touches any object on which she sat must wash his garments, and he shall wash himself with water, and he shall be unclean until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if it is on the bed or on the object on which she sits, at his touching it he becomes unclean until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a man indeed lies with her and her menstruation occurs on him, then he shall be unclean for seven days, and any bed on which he lies down becomes unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And when a woman discharges a body fluid consisting of her blood for many days, but not at the time of her menstruation, or when she discharges in addition to her menstruation, all the days of her unclean body fluid discharge she shall become unclean as in the days of her menstruation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Any bed on which she lies during all the days of her body fluid discharge shall become for her as her bed of menstruation, and any object on which she sits becomes unclean as her menstruation’s uncleanness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And any person who touches them becomes unclean, and he shall wash his garments, and he shall wash himself with water, and he shall be unclean until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And if she is clean from her body fluid discharge, then she shall count for herself seven days, and afterward she becomes clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the eighth day she shall take for herself two turtledoves or two young doves, and she shall bring them to the priest at the tent of assembly’s entrance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest shall sacrifice the one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering, and so the priest shall make atonement for her before Yahweh from her unclean body fluid discharge.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And you shall keep the Israelites separate from their uncleanness so that they might not die because of their uncleanness by their making my tabernacle, which is in their midst, unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is the regulation of the one with the body fluid discharge and the one from whom an emission of semen goes out so that he becomes unclean by it
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and concerning the menstruating woman in her bleeding and the person who discharges his body fluid, for the male and for the female and for a man who lies with an unclean woman.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh spoke to Moses after the death of Aaron’s two sons, when they had come near before Yahweh and they died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Yahweh said to Moses, “Tell your brother Aaron that he should not enter at any time into the sanctuary behind the curtain in front of the atonement cover that is on the ark, so that he might not die, because I appear in the cloud over the atonement cover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Aaron must enter the sanctuary with this: a young bull as a sin offering and a ram as a burnt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He must put on a holy linen tunic, and linen undergarments must be on his body, and he must fasten himself with a linen sash, and he must wrap a linen turban around his head—they are holy garments, and he shall wash his body with water, then he shall put them on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he must take from the Israelites’ community two he-goats as a sin offering and one ram as a burnt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And Aaron shall present the sin offering’s bull, which is for himself, and so he shall make atonement for himself and for his family.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall take the two goats, and he shall present them before Yahweh at the tent of assembly’s entrance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Aaron shall cast lots for the two goats: one lot for Yahweh and one for Azazel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron shall present the goat on which the lot for Yahweh fell, and he shall sacrifice it as a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he must present alive before Yahweh the goat on which the lot for Azazel fell to make atonement for himself, to send it away into the desert to Azazel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And Aaron shall present the sin offering’s bull, which is for himself, and so he shall make atonement for himself and for his family; then he shall slaughter the sin offering’s bull, which is for himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall take a censer full of burning charcoal from upon the altar from before Yahweh and two handfuls of incense of powdered fragrant perfumes, and he shall bring it from behind the curtain,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he shall put the incense on the fire before Yahweh so that the cloud of incense might cover the atonement cover, which is on the covenant text, so that he might not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall take some of the bull’s blood, and he shall spatter it with his finger on the atonement cover’s surface on the eastern side, and before the atonement cover he shall spatter some of the blood with his finger seven times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And he shall slaughter the sin offering’s goat, which is for the people, and he shall bring its blood from behind the curtain, and he shall do with its blood as that which he did with the bull’s blood, and he shall spatter it on the atonement cover and before the atonement cover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus he shall make atonement for the sanctuary from the Israelites’ impurities and from their transgressions for all their sins; and so he must do for the tent of assembly, which dwells with them in the midst of their impurities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And no person shall be in the tent of assembly when he enters to make atonement in the sanctuary until he comes out, and so he shall make atonement for himself and for his family and for all of Israel’s assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then he shall go out to the altar that is before Yahweh, and he shall make atonement for it; and he shall take some of the bull’s blood and some of the goat’s blood, and he shall put it all around on the altar’s horns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall spatter some of the blood on it seven times with his finger, and he shall cleanse it and consecrate it from the Israelites’ impurities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And he shall finish making atonement for the sanctuary and the tent of assembly and the altar; then he shall present the living goat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron shall place his two hands on the living goat’s head, and he shall confess over it all the Israelites’ iniquities and all their transgressions for all their sins, and he shall put them on the goat’s head, and he shall send it away into the desert with a man standing ready.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus the goat shall bear on it to a barren region all their guilt, and he shall send the goat away into the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And Aaron shall enter the tent of assembly, and he shall take off the linen garments that he put on at his coming to the sanctuary, and he shall leave them there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall wash his body with water in a holy place, and he shall put on his garments and go out and sacrifice his burnt offering and the people’s burnt offering, and so he shall make atonement for himself and for people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he must turn into smoke the sin offering’s fat on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And the person who sends out the goat for Azazel shall wash his garments, and he shall wash his body with water, and afterward he shall come to the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sin offering’s bull and the sin offering’s goat, whose blood was brought to make atonement in the sanctuary, shall be brought outside the camp, and they shall burn their hide and their flesh and their offal in the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the person who burns them shall wash his garments, and he shall wash his body with water, and afterward he must come to the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And this shall be a lasting statute for you: in the seventh month, on the tenth of the month, you must deny yourselves and you must not do any work, whether the native or the alien who is dwelling in your midst,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because on this day he shall make atonement for you to cleanse you; you must be clean from all your sins before Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is a Sabbath of complete rest for you, and you shall deny yourselves—it is a lasting statute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest who is anointed and who is ordained to serve as a priest in place of his father shall make atonement; thus he shall put on the linen garments, the holy garments,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he shall make atonement for the sanctuary’s holy place, and he shall make atonement for the tent of assembly and the altar, and he shall make atonement for the priests and for all of the assembly’s people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this shall be a lasting statute for you to make atonement for the Israelites one time in a year from all their sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to Aaron and to his sons and to all the Israelites, and you shall say to them, ‘This is the word that Yahweh has commanded, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Any man from the house of Israel who slaughters an ox or a sheep or a goat in the camp or who slaughters it outside the camp
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he does not bring it to the tent of assembly’s entrance to present an offering to Yahweh before Yahweh’s tabernacle, then that man shall be accounted bloodguilty—he has poured out blood, and that man shall be cut off from the midst of his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is so that the Israelites may bring their sacrifices that they are sacrificing in the open field and bring them for Yahweh to the tent of assembly’s entrance to the priest, and they shall sacrifice fellowship offerings for Yahweh with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest shall sprinkle the blood on Yahweh’s altar at the tent of assembly’s entrance, and he shall burn the fat as an appeasing fragrance for Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they may no longer sacrifice their sacrifices to the goat-idols after which they were prostituting. This is a lasting statute for them throughout their generations.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And you shall say to them, ‘if there is anyone from the house of Israel or from the alien who dwells in their midst who offers a burnt offering or a sacrifice
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he does not bring it to the tent of assembly’s entrance to sacrifice it for Yahweh, then that man shall be cut off from his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if there is anyone from the house of Israel or from the alien who is dwelling in their midst who eats any blood, then I will set my face against the person who eats the blood, and I will cut him off from among his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed the flesh’s life is in the blood, and I have given it to you on the altar to make atonement for your lives, because it is the blood with the life that makes atonement.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I said to the Israelites, ‘None of you may eat blood, nor may the alien who is dwelling in your midst eat blood.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And if there is anyone from the Israelites or from the alien who is dwelling in their midst who hunts a wild game animal or a bird that may be eaten, then he shall pour out its blood, and he shall cover it with the soil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, the life of all flesh, its blood, is in its life, so I said to the Israelites, ‘You may not eat the blood of any flesh, because the life of all flesh is its blood; anyone who eats it must be cut off.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And if there is any person who eats a dead body or a mangled carcass, whether among the native or among the alien, then he shall wash his garments, and he shall wash himself with water, and he shall be unclean until the evening, and he shall be clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he does not wash his garments and he does not wash his body, then he shall bear his guilt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the Israelites, and say to them, ‘I am Yahweh your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not carry out the practices of the land of Egypt, in which you lived, and you must not carry out the practices of the land of Canaan, to which I am bringing you; and you must not follow their statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must carry out my regulations, and you must observe my statutes by following them; I am Yahweh your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall observe my statutes and my regulations by which the person doing them shall live; I am Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘None of you shall approach anyone who is his close relative to expose nakedness; I am Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not expose your father’s nakedness or your mother’s nakedness—she is your mother; you must not expose her nakedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not expose the nakedness of your father’s wife—it is your father’s nakedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for your sister’s nakedness, whether your father’s daughter or your mother’s daughter, whether born at home or born abroad, you must not expose their nakedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the nakedness of your son’s daughter or your daughter’s daughter, you must not expose their nakedness, because they are your nakedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the nakedness of the daughter of your father’s wife, she is your sister, a relative of your father; you must not expose her nakedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not expose the nakedness of your father’s sister; she is your father’s close relative.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not expose the nakedness of your mother’s sister, because she is your mother’s close relative.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not expose the nakedness of your father’s brother; you must not have sex with his wife—she is your aunt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not expose your daughter-in-law’s nakedness; she is your son’s wife; you must not expose her nakedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not expose the nakedness of your brother’s wife; she is your brother’s nakedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not expose the nakedness of a woman and her daughter, or her son’s daughter, or her daughter’s daughter; you must not take her as wife to expose her nakedness; they are close relatives—that is wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you must not take as wife a woman with her sister, to be a rival-wife, to expose her nakedness before her during her life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And you must not have sex with a woman to expose her nakedness during her menstrual uncleanness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you must not have sex with your fellow citizen’s wife, becoming unclean with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And you shall not give any of your offspring in order to sacrifice them to Molech, nor shall you profane the name of your God; I am Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall not lie with a male as lying with a woman; that is a detestable thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall not have sexual relations with any animal, becoming unclean with it; and a woman shall not stand before an animal to copulate with it—that is a perversion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘You must not make yourself unclean in any of these things, because the nations whom I am driving out from your presence were made unclean by all of these.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the land became unclean, and I have brought the punishment of its guilt upon it, and the land has vomited out its inhabitants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you (neither the native nor the alien who is dwelling in your midst) shall keep my statutes and my regulations, and you shall not practice any of these detestable things
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (because the people of the land, who were before you, did all these detestable things, so the land became unclean),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that the land will not vomit you out when you make it unclean just as it vomited out the nation that was before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, anyone who does any of these detestable things, even those persons who do so shall be cut off from the midst of their people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus you shall keep my obligation to not do any of the statutes regarding the detestable things that they did before you, so that you will not make yourselves unclean by them; I am Yahweh your God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to all the community of the Israelites, and say to them, ‘You must be holy, because I, Yahweh your God, am holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each of you must revere your mother and your father, and you must keep my Sabbaths; I am Yahweh your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not turn to idols, and you must not make for yourselves gods of cast metal; I am Yahweh your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And when you sacrifice a sacrifice of fellowship offerings to Yahweh, you must sacrifice it for your acceptance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It must be eaten on the day of your sacrifice and the next day; but the remainder must be burned up in the fire by the third day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if it is indeed eaten on the third day, it is unclean meat; it shall not be regarded as accepted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the one who eats it shall bear his guilt, because he has profaned Yahweh’s holiness, and that person shall be cut off from his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And at your reaping the harvest of your land you must not finish reaping the edge of your field, and you must not glean the remnants of your harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you must not glean your vineyard, and you must not gather your vineyard’s fallen grapes; you must leave them behind for the needy and for the alien; I am Yahweh your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘You shall not steal, and you shall not deceive, and you shall not lie to one another;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you shall not swear falsely in my name, and so one of you profane the name of your God; I am Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘You shall not exploit your neighbor, and you shall not rob him; a hired worker’s wage you shall not withhold overnight until morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not curse the deaf, and you shall not put a stumbling block before a blind person, but you shall revere your God; I am Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘You shall not do injustice in judgment; you shall not show partiality to the powerless; you shall not give preference to the powerful; you shall judge your fellow citizen with justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not go about with slander among your people; you shall not endanger your neighbor’s life; I am Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘You shall not hate your brother in your heart; you shall surely rebuke your fellow citizen, so that you do not incur sin along with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not seek vengeance, and you shall not harbor a grudge against your fellow citizens; and you shall love your neighbor like yourself; I am Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘You must keep my statutes: as for your domestic animals, you shall not cause two differing kinds to breed; as for your field, you shall not sow two differing kinds of seed; and, a garment of two differing kinds of woven material should not be worn on you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And when a man lies with a woman and there is an emission of semen and she is a female slave promised to a man, but she indeed has not been ransomed or freedom has not be given to her, there shall be an obligation to compensate; they shall not be put to death, because she has not been freed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall bring his guilt offering to Yahweh at the tent of assembly’s entrance: a ram for a guilt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest shall make atonement for him before Yahweh with the ram of the guilt offering for his sin that he committed, and so his sin that he committed shall be forgiven him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And when you have come into the land and you plant any tree for food, you shall regard its fruit as unharvestable; for three years it shall be forbidden for you; it shall not be eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in the fourth year all its fruit shall be holy, offerings of praise for Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the fifth year you shall eat its fruit to increase its yield for you; I am Yahweh your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘You must not eat anything with the blood; you shall not practice divination, nor shall you interpret signs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not round off the corner hair of your head, and you shall not trim the corner of your beard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall not make a slash in your body for a dead person, nor shall you make on yourselves a tattoo’s mark; I am Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘You shall not profane your daughter by making her a prostitute, lest the land be prostituted and the land fill up with depravity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall keep my Sabbaths, and you shall revere my sanctuary; I am Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘You shall not turn to the mediums and to the soothsayers; you shall not seek them to become unclean with them; I am Yahweh your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘Before old age you shall get up, and you shall show respect for an old person; and you shall revere your God; I am Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And when an alien dwells with you in your land, you shall not oppress him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The alien who is dwelling with you shall be like a native among you, and you shall love him like yourself, because you were aliens in the land of Egypt; I am Yahweh your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘You shall not commit injustice in regulation, in measurement, in weight, or volume.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must have honest balances, honest weights, an honest ephah, and an honest hin; I am Yahweh your God who brought you out from the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘Thus you shall keep all my statutes and all my regulations, and you shall do them; I am Yahweh.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And to the Israelites you shall say, ‘If there is anyone from the Israelites or from the alien who is dwelling in Israel, who gives any of his offspring to Molech, he must surely be put to death; the people of the land must stone him with stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I myself will set my face against that man, and I will cut him off from the midst of his people, because he has given some of his offspring to Molech, so that he makes my sanctuary unclean and profanes my holy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if the people of the land ever shut their eyes from that man at his giving some of his offspring to Molech, not putting him to death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I myself will set my face against that man and against his clan, and I will cut him off and all those from the midst of their people who prostitute after Molech.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the person who turns to the mediums and the soothsayers to prostitute after them, I will set my face against that person, and I will cut him off from the midst of his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And you shall consecrate yourselves, and you shall be holy, because I am Yahweh your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall keep my statutes, and you shall do them; I am Yahweh who consecrates you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘If there is anyone who curses his father or his mother, he shall surely be put to death; he has cursed his father and his mother—his blood is upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘As for a man who commits adultery with a man’s wife, who commits adultery with his neighbor’s wife, both the man who commits adultery and the woman who commits adultery shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for a man who lies with his father’s wife, he has exposed his father’s nakedness; both of them shall be put to death—their blood is on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for a man who lies with his daughter-in-law, both of them shall be put to death; they have committed a perversion—their blood is on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘As for the man who lies with a male as lying with a woman, they have committed a detestable thing; they shall surely be put to death—their blood is on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘As for a man who marries a woman and her mother, that is depravity; they shall burn him and them, so that it shall not become depravity in the midst of you all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘As for a man who has sexual relations with an animal, he shall surely be put to death, and you must kill the animal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for a woman who approaches any animal to copulate with it, you shall kill the woman and the animal; they shall surely be put to death—their blood is on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘As for a man who takes his sister, his father’s daughter or his mother’s daughter, and he sees her nakedness and she herself sees his nakedness, it is a disgrace, and they shall be cut off before the eyes of their people; he has exposed his sister’s nakedness—he must bear his guilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for a man who lies with a menstruating woman, he exposes her nakedness—her source he exposes and she herself reveals her blood’s source—both of them shall be cut off from the midst of their people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall not expose the nakedness of your mother’s sister, and you shall not expose your father’s sister, because such a person has dishonored his close relative—they must bear their guilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for a man who lies with his aunt, he has exposed his uncle’s nakedness—they shall bear their sin; they shall die childless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for a man who marries his brother’s wife, it is an abomination; he has exposed his brother’s nakedness—they shall be childless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And you shall keep all my statutes and all my regulations, and you shall do them, so that the land, to which I am bringing you to inhabit it, shall not vomit you out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall not follow the statutes of the nation that I am driving out from before you, because they did all these things, and I detested them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I said to you, “You yourselves shall take possession of their land, and I myself shall give it to you to possess it—a land flowing with milk and honey”; I am Yahweh your God, who has set you apart from the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall distinguish between the clean and the unclean animal and between the unclean and the clean bird; and you shall not defile yourselves with the animal or with the bird or with anything that moves along the ground that I have set apart for you as unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall be holy for me, because I, Yahweh, am holy, and I have singled you out from the nations to be mine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And a man or a woman, if a spirit of the dead or a spirit of divination is in them, they shall surely be put to death; they shall stone them with stones—their blood is on them.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh said to Moses, “Speak to the priests, Aaron’s sons, and say to them, ‘One must not make himself unclean for a dead person among his own people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: except for his direct relative closest to him: his mother and his father, and his son and his daughter, and his brother,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for his sister, a virgin, who is closest to him, who has not had a husband—for her he may defile himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He must not make himself unclean as a kinsman by marriage, defiling himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And they shall not shave bald patches on their head, and they shall not shave off the corner of their beard, and they shall not make a cut in their body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall be holy to their God, and they shall not profane the name of their God, because they are bringing near the offerings made by fire to Yahweh—their God’s food—and they shall be holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘They shall not marry a woman who is a prostitute and defiled, nor shall they marry a woman divorced from her husband, because each priest is holy for his God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall consecrate him, because he is bringing near your God’s food; he shall be holy to you, since I, Yahweh, who consecrates you, am holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘As for the daughter of any priest, if she is defiled by prostituting, she is disgracing her father—she shall be burned in the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘As for the priest who is higher than his brothers, on whose head the oil of anointment is poured and he was ordained to wear the garments, he shall not dishevel his head, and he shall not tear his garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall not go near any dead person, nor shall he make himself unclean for his father or for his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall not go out from the sanctuary, and he shall not profane his God’s sanctuary, because the dedication of his God’s oil of anointment is on him; I am Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And he himself must take a wife in her virginity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A widow or a divorced woman or a defiled woman, a prostitute—these he must not take; he shall take only a virgin from his people as wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall not profane his offspring among his people, because I am Yahweh, who consecrates him.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to Aaron, saying, ‘A man from your offspring throughout their generations, in whom is a physical defect, shall not come near to present your God’s food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, any man in whom is a physical defect shall not come near: a blind man or lame or disfigured or deformed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or a man in whom is a broken foot or a broken hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or a hunchback or a dwarf, or a spot in his eye or a skin disorder or a skin eruption or a crushed testicle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Any man from Aaron the priest’s offspring in whom is a physical defect shall not come near to present offerings made by fire to Yahweh; a physical defect is in him; he shall not come near to present his God’s food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He may eat his God’s food, from the most holy things and from the holy things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he must not enter the curtain, and he must not come near to the altar, because a physical defect is in him, and he must not profane my sanctuary, because I am Yahweh, who consecrates them.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus Moses spoke to Aaron and to his sons and to all the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell Aaron and his sons that they must deal respectfully with the Israelites’ votive offerings, and they must not profane my holy name, which they are consecrating to me; I am Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Say to them, ‘Throughout your generations, any man from any of your offspring who comes near the votive offerings that the Israelites consecrate to Yahweh with his uncleanness on him, that person shall be cut off from before me; I am Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘Anyone from Aaron’s offspring, if he is afflicted with a skin disease or a fluid discharge, shall not eat in the sanctuary until he is clean; and the one who touches any unclean person or a man from whom an emission of semen goes out,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or a man who touches any swarmer that is unclean for him or who touches a person who is unclean for him due to whatever his uncleanness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a person who touches such a thing shall be unclean until the evening, and he shall not eat from the votive offerings, except when he washes his body with water
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sun sets, and he shall be clean; then afterward he may eat from the votive offerings, because it is his food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall not eat a naturally dead body or a mangled carcass, so that he becomes unclean by it; I am Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And they shall keep my obligation, and they shall not incur guilt because of it, so that they die through it, because they have profaned it; I am Yahweh who consecrates them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘No stranger shall eat the votive offering; nor shall a temporary resident with a priest or a hired worker eat the votive offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a priest, if with his money he buys a person as his possession, that one may eat it, and the descendants of his house themselves may eat his food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a priest’s daughter, when she marries a layman, she herself may not eat the votive offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a priest’s daughter, when she becomes a widow or divorced or there is no offspring for her, and she returns to her father’s house as in her childhood, she may eat from her father’s food, but no layman may eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a man eats the votive offering unintentionally, then he shall add to it a fifth of it, and he shall give the votive offering to the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall not profane the Israelites’ votive offerings that they present to Yahweh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and so cause them, by their eating their votive offerings, to bear guilt requiring a guilt offering, because I am Yahweh, who consecrates them.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to Aaron and to his sons and to all the Israelites, and say to them, ‘Anyone from the house of Israel or from the alien in Israel who presents his offering for any of their vows or for any of their freewill offerings that they present to Yahweh as a burnt offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: it must be without defect to be acceptable for you: a male among the cattle, among the sheep, or among the goats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not present any animal in which is a physical defect, because it shall not be acceptable for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if anyone brings a sacrifice of fellowship offerings for Yahweh to fulfill a vow or as a freewill offering from the cattle or from the flock, it must be without defect to be acceptable; there must not be any physical defect in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The blind or the injured or the maimed or the seeping or one with a skin disorder or one with a skin eruption—these you shall not present to Yahweh, nor shall you give from them an offering made by fire on the altar for Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for an ox or sheep that is deformed or that is stunted, you may present it as a freewill offering, but for a vow it will not be accepted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall not present anything for Yahweh with bruised or shattered or torn or cut-off testicles, and you shall not sacrifice such in your land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall not present your God’s food from any of these by the hand of a foreigner, because their deformity is in them; a physical defect is in them; they shall not be accepted for you.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When an ox or a sheep or a goat is born, then it shall be under its mother for seven days, and from the eighth day and beyond it is acceptable as an offering made by fire for Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall not slaughter an ox or a sheep and its young on the same day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when you sacrifice a sacrifice of thanksgiving to Yahweh, you must sacrifice it to be acceptable for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It must be eaten on that day; you must not leave over anything from it until morning; I am Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus you shall keep my commands, and you shall do them; I am Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And you shall not profane my holy name, so that I may be consecrated in the midst of the Israelites; I am Yahweh, who consecrates you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the one who brought you out from the land of Egypt to be as God for you; I am Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the Israelites, and say to them, ‘The festivals of Yahweh that you shall proclaim are holy assemblies; these are my appointed times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘For six days work is to be done, and on the seventh day shall be a Sabbath of complete rest, a holy assembly; you shall not do any work; it shall be a Sabbath for Yahweh in all your dwellings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘These are Yahweh’s appointed times, holy assemblies, which you shall proclaim at their appointed time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the first month, on the fourteenth of the month at the evening is Yahweh’s Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the fifteenth day of this month is Yahweh’s Feast of Unleavened Bread; for seven days you shall eat unleavened bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day there shall be a holy assembly for you; you shall not do any regular work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall present an offering for Yahweh made by fire for seven days; on the seventh day there shall be a holy assembly; you shall not do any regular work.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the Israelites, and say to them, ‘When you come to the land that I am about to give to you and you reap its harvest, then you shall bring a sheaf of the firstfruit of your harvest to the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall wave the sheaf before Yahweh for your acceptance; the priest shall wave it on the day after the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the day of your waving the sheaf you shall offer a yearling male lamb without defect as a burnt offering to Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And its grain offering shall be two-tenths of an ephah of finely milled flour mixed with oil, an offering made by fire for Yahweh, an appeasing fragrance; and its libation shall be a fourth of a hin of wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall not eat bread or roasted grain or ripe grain until this very same day, until you present your God’s offering. This must be a lasting statute for your generations in all your dwellings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And you shall count for yourselves from the day after the Sabbath, from the day of your bringing the wave offering’s sheaf—there shall be seven full weeks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Until the day after the seventh Sabbath you shall count fifty days; then you shall present a new grain offering for Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall bring from your dwellings for a wave offering two loaves of bread made with two-tenths of an ephah of finely milled flour; they must be baked with leaven—the firstfruits belonging to Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And, in addition to the bread, you shall present seven yearling male lambs without defects and one young bull and two rams—they shall be a burnt offering for Yahweh with their grain offering and their libations, an offering made by fire, an appeasing fragrance for Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall offer one he-goat as a sin offering and two yearling male lambs as a sacrifice of fellowship offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest shall wave them with the bread of the firstfruits as a wave offering before Yahweh; in addition to the two male lambs, they shall be holy for Yahweh for the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall make a proclamation on this very same day; it shall be a holy assembly for you; you shall not do any regular work; this is a lasting statute in all your dwellings throughout your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when you reap the harvest of your land, you must not finish the edge of your field at your reaping, and you must not glean the remnants of your harvest—you shall leave them behind for the needy and for the alien; I am Yahweh your God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the Israelites, saying, ‘In the seventh month, on the first day of the month, you must have a rest period, a remembrance of the trumpet blast, a holy assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not do any regular work, and you shall present an offering made by fire to Yahweh.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Surely the Day of Atonement is on the tenth day of the seventh month; it shall be a holy assembly for you, and you shall deny yourselves, and you shall present an offering made by fire to Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you must not do any regular work on this very same day, because it is the Day of Atonement to make atonement for you before Yahweh your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If there is any person who does not deny himself on this very same day, then he shall be cut off from his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for any person who does any work on this very same day, I will exterminate that person from the midst of his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not do any work; it is a lasting statute throughout your generations in all your dwellings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is a Sabbath of complete rest for you, and you shall deny yourselves on the ninth day of the month in the evening—from evening to evening you must observe your extraordinary Sabbath.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the Israelites, saying, ‘On the fifteenth day of the seventh month, this shall be the Feast of Booths for seven days for Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day there shall be a holy assembly; you must not do any regular work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For seven days you must present an offering made by fire to Yahweh. On the eighth day it shall be a holy assembly for you, and you shall present an offering made by fire to Yahweh; it is a celebration; you must not do any regular work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘These are Yahweh’s festivals, which you must proclaim, holy assemblies to present an offering made by fire to Yahweh—burnt offering and grain offering, sacrifice and libations, each on its proper day—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: besides Yahweh’s Sabbaths and besides your gifts and besides your vows and besides all your freewill offerings that you give to Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘Surely on the fifteenth day of the seventh month, at your gathering the land’s produce, you shall hold Yahweh’s festival for seven days; on the first day there shall be a rest period and on the eighth day a rest period.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the first day you shall take for yourselves the first fruit of majestic trees, branches of palm trees and branches of a leafy tree and of a brook’s poplar trees, and you shall rejoice before Yahweh your God for seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you must hold it as a festival for Yahweh for seven days in the year; it shall be a lasting statute throughout your generations; in the seventh month you must hold it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must live in the booths for seven days; all the natives in Israel must live in the booths,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that your generations shall know that I made the Israelites live in booths when I brought them from the land of Egypt; I am Yahweh your God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus Moses announced to the Israelites Yahweh’s appointed times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Command the Israelites that they should bring pure olive oil from beaten olives for the light to present a lamp continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron shall arrange for it outside the curtain of the testimony in the tent of assembly from evening until morning before Yahweh continually; it shall be a lasting statute throughout your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the pure golden lampstand he shall arrange for the lamps before Yahweh continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And you shall take finely milled flour, and you shall bake with it twelve ring-shaped bread cakes: each one shall be two-tenths of an ephah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall place them in two rows, six to the row, on the pure gold table before Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall put pure frankincense on each row so that it shall be for the bread as a memorial offering, an offering made by fire for Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On every Sabbath he shall arrange it in rows before Yahweh continually; they are from the Israelites as an everlasting covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be for Aaron and for his sons, and they shall eat it in a holy place, because it is a most holy thing for him from Yahweh’s offerings made by fire—a lasting rule.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And an Israelite woman’s son, and he was an Egyptian man’s son, went out in the midst of the Israelites; and the Israelite woman’s son and an Israelite man fought in the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Israelite woman’s son blasphemed the name, and he cursed, so they brought him to Moses—and the name of his mother was Shelomith the daughter of Dibri, of the tribe of Dan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they put him in custody so that the matter might be made clear to them in accordance with the mouth of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Bring the curser outside the camp, and all the hearers shall place their hands on his head, and the whole community shall stone him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall speak to the Israelites, saying, ‘Any man when he curses his God shall bear his sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he who blasphemes Yahweh’s name certainly shall be put to death; the whole community certainly shall stone him. As the alien, so the native shall be put to death at blaspheming his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And when a man kills any human being, he certainly shall be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he who kills a domestic animal must repay for it life in place of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when a man causes a physical defect in his fellow citizen according to what he has done, so it shall be done to him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: fracture in place of fracture, eye in place of eye, tooth in place of tooth—according to the physical defect he causes to the person, likewise it shall be caused to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a killer of a domestic animal must repay for it, and a killer of a human shall be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must have one norm; as for the alien, so it must be for the native, because I am Yahweh your God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus Moses spoke to the Israelites, and they brought the curser outside the camp, and they stoned him with stones, and the Israelites did just as Yahweh had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh spoke to Moses on Mount Sinai, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the Israelites, and say to them, ‘When you come into the land that I am about to give to you, then the land shall observe a Sabbath for Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six years you shall sow your field, and six years you shall prune your vineyard, and you shall gather its yield.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in the seventh year it shall be a Sabbath of complete rest for the land—a Sabbath for Yahweh; you must not sow your field, and you must not prune your vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not reap your harvest’s aftergrowth, and you must not harvest the grapes of your unpruned vines—it shall be a year of complete rest for the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a Sabbath of the land shall be for food for you: for you and for your slave and for your slave woman and for your hired worker and for your temporary residents who are dwelling as aliens with you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all its yield shall be for your domestic animal and for the wild animal, which are in your land to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And you shall count for yourself seven Sabbaths of years, seven times seven years, and they shall be for you time periods of years: forty-nine years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall cause a loud horn blast to be heard on the seventh month on the tenth of the month; on the Day of Atonement you shall cause a ram’s horn to be heard in all your land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall consecrate the fiftieth year, and you shall proclaim a release in the land for all its inhabitants. It is a Jubilee; it shall be for you, and you shall return. You must return—everyone to his property and everyone to his clan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall have the fiftieth year as a Jubilee; you must not reap its aftergrowth, and you must not harvest its unpruned vines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because it is a Jubilee, it shall be holy to you. You must eat its produce from the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘In this Year of Jubilee each of you shall return to his property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when you sell something to your fellow citizen or you buy from your neighbor’s hand, you must not oppress one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must buy from your fellow citizen according to the number of years after the Jubilee; he must sell to you according to the number of years of yield.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must increase its price according to a greater number of years, but you must decrease its price according to a lesser number of years, because he is selling its yields to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you must not oppress one another, but you shall revere your God, because I am Yahweh, your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And you shall do my statutes, and you must keep my regulations, and you shall do them, so that you shall live securely on the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the land shall give its fruit, and you shall eat your fill, and you shall live securely on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if you should say, “What shall we eat in the seventh year, if we do not sow and we do not gather its yield?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will command my blessing for you in the sixth year, so that it will make the yield for three years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you will sow in the eighth year, and you shall eat from the old yield; until the ninth year, until the coming of its yield, you shall eat the old yield.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘But the land must not be sold in perpetuity, because the land is mine, because you are aliens and temporary residents with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in all your property’s land you must provide redemption for the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘When your brother becomes poor and he sells part of his property, then his nearest redeemer shall come, and he shall redeem the thing sold by his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if a man does not have a redeemer, then he prospers and he finds enough for his redemption,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then he shall calculate the years of its selling, and he shall refund the balance to the man to whom he sold it, and he shall return to his property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if his hand does not find enough to refund to him, then what he has sold shall be in the buyer’s hand until the Year of Jubilee; and it shall go out of the buyer’s hand in the Jubilee, and he shall return to his property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And if a man sells a residential house in a walled city, then it shall be his redemption until completing a year after his selling; its redemption shall last a year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if it is not redeemed before a full year has passed, then the house that is in the walled city shall belong to the buyer in perpetuity throughout his generations; it shall not go out of the buyer’s hand in the Jubilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, village houses that have no surrounding wall shall be considered open country; there is redemption for it, and in the Jubilee it shall go out of the buyer’s hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘As for the cities of the Levites, that is, the houses in their property’s cities, it shall be a lasting redemption for the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whatever anyone redeems from the Levites then must go out of the buyer’s hand in the Jubilee, including a house’s selling in his city’s property, because the houses in the cities of the Levites are their property in the midst of the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a field of their cities’ pastureland must not be sold, because it is their property for all time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And if your countryman becomes poor and if he becomes dependent on you, then you shall support him like an alien and like a temporary resident, and he shall live with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not take interest or usury from him, but you shall revere your God, and your countryman shall live with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not give your money to him with interest or give your food for profit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am Yahweh your God, who brought you out from the land of Egypt to give you the land of Canaan, to be as God for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And if your countryman who is with you becomes poor, and he is sold to you, you shall not treat him as a slave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall be with you like a hired worker, like a temporary resident; he shall work with you until the Year of Jubilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he and his sons with him shall go out from you, and he shall return to his clan, and to the property of his ancestors he shall return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because they are my servants whom I brought out from the land of Egypt, they shall not be sold as a slave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not rule over him with ruthlessness, but you shall revere your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘As for your slave and your slave woman who are yours, from the nations that are all around you, from them you may buy a slave or a slave woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you may buy also from the children of the temporary residents who are dwelling with you as aliens and from their clan who are with you, who have children in your land; indeed, they may be as property for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you may pass them on as an inheritance to your sons after you to take possession of as property for all time—you may let them work. But as for your countrymen, the Israelites, you shall not rule with ruthlessness over one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And if the alien or the temporary resident who are with you prosper, but your countryman who is with him becomes poor and he is sold to an alien, a temporary resident who is with you, or to a descendant of an alien’s clan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: after he is sold redemption shall be for him; one of his brothers may redeem him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or his uncle or his uncle’s son may redeem him, or one of his close relatives from his clan may redeem him; or if he prospers, he may redeem himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall calculate with his buyer from the year of his selling himself until the Jubilee; and the value of his selling shall be according to the number of years—it shall be with him like a hired worker’s days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If there are still many years, in keeping with them he shall restore his redemption in proportion to his purchase price.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if there are a few years left until the Year of Jubilee, then he shall calculate for himself; he shall restore his redemption according to the number of his years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall be with him as a yearly hired worker; he shall not rule over him with ruthlessness in your sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he is not redeemed by any of these ways, then he and his sons with him shall go out in the Year of Jubilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, the Israelites are servants for me; they are my servants whom I brought out from the land of Egypt. I am Yahweh your God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘You shall not make for yourselves idols and divine images, and you shall not raise up stone pillars for yourselves, and you shall not put a sculptured stone in your land in order to worship before it, because I am Yahweh your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘You shall keep my Sabbaths, and you shall revere my sanctuary; I am Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘If you walk in my statutes and you keep my commands and you do them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will give you rains in their time, and the land shall give its produce, and the trees of the field shall give their fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for you the threshing season shall overtake the grape harvest, and the grape harvest shall overtake the sowing, and you shall eat your food to your fill and you shall live securely in your land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will give peace in the land, and you shall lie down, and there shall not be anybody who makes you afraid, and I will remove harmful animals from the land, and no sword shall pass through your land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall pursue your enemies, and they shall fall by the sword before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And five of you shall pursue a hundred, and a hundred of you shall pursue a myriad; and your enemies shall fall by the sword before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will turn to you, and I will make you fruitful, and I will make you numerous; and I will keep my covenant with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall eat old grain, and you shall clear away the old before the new.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will put my dwelling place in your midst, and my inner self shall not abhor you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will walk about in your midst, and I shall be your God, and you shall be my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am Yahweh, your God who brought you out from the land of Egypt, from being their slaves; and I broke the bars of your yoke, and I caused you to walk erectly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘But if you do not listen to me and you do not carry out all these commands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if you reject my statutes and if your inner self abhors my regulations, to not carry out all my commands by your breaking my covenant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I in turn will do this to you: then I will summon onto you horror, the wasting disease, and the fever that wastes eyes and that drains away life; and you shall sow your seed in vain, and your enemies shall eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will set my face against you, and you shall be defeated before your enemies; and your haters shall rule over you, and you shall flee away, but there shall not be anybody who is pursuing you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And if in spite of these things you do not listen to me, then I will continue to discipline you seven times for your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will break the pride of your strength; and I will make your heaven like iron and your land like copper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And your strength shall be consumed in vain; and your land shall not give its produce, and the land’s trees shall not give their fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And if you go against me in hostility and you are not willing to listen to me, then I will add a plague onto you seven times according to your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will send wild animals out among you, and they shall make you childless, and they shall cut down your domestic animals, and they shall make you fewer; and your roads shall be desolate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And if you do not accept correction from me through these things, but you go against me in hostility,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I myself will also go against you in hostility, and I myself also will strike you seven times for your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will bring upon you a sword that seeks vengeance for the covenant, and you shall be gathered to your cities; and I will send a plague in your midst, and you shall be given into the hand of an enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At my breaking the supply of bread for you, then ten women shall bake your bread in one oven, and they shall return your bread by weight; and you shall eat it, and you shall not be satisfied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And if through this you do not listen to me and you go against me in hostility,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will go against you in hostile anger, and also I myself will discipline you seven times for your sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall eat the flesh of your sons; and the flesh of your daughters you shall eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will destroy your high places, and I will cut down your incense altars, and I will place your corpses on your idols’ corpses; and my inner self shall abhor you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will lay your cities in ruins, and I will lay waste your sanctuaries; and I shall not smell your sacrifices’ appeasing fragrance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I myself will lay waste the land, and your enemies who are living in it shall be appalled over it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will scatter you among the nations, and I will draw a sword behind you; and your land shall be a desolation, and your cities shall be a ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the land shall enjoy its Sabbaths all the days of its lying desolate, and you shall be in the land of your enemies; then the land shall rest, and it shall enjoy its Sabbaths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the days of its lying desolate it shall rest for the time that it had not rested during your Sabbaths while you were living on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the ones who remain among you, I will bring fearfulness in their hearts in the land of their enemies; and a sound of a windblown leaf shall pursue them, and they shall flee like flight before a sword, and they shall fall, but there shall not be a pursuer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall stumble over one another as from before a sword, but there shall not be a pursuer; and you shall have no resistance before your enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall perish among the nations, and the land of your enemies shall eat you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because of their guilt, the ones among you who remain shall decay in the land of their enemies; and also because of the iniquities of their ancestors, they shall decay with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘But when they confess their guilt and the guilt of their ancestors in their infidelity that they displayed against me, and moreover that they went against me in hostility—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I myself also went against them in hostility, and I brought them into the land of their enemies—or if then their uncircumcised heart is humbled and then they pay for their guilt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will remember my covenant with Jacob; and I will remember also my covenant with Isaac and also my covenant with Abraham, and I will remember the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the land shall be deserted by them, and it shall enjoy its Sabbaths in its being desolate from them, and they themselves must pay for their guilt, simply because they rejected my regulations, and their inner self abhorred my statutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in spite of this, when they are in the land of their enemies I will not reject them, and I will not abhor them to destroy them, to break my covenant with them, because I am Yahweh their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will remember the first covenant for them—whom I brought out from the land of Egypt in the sight of the nations to be their God. I am Yahweh.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the rules and the regulations and the laws that Yahweh gave between himself and the Israelites on Mount Sinai through Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the Israelites, and say to them, ‘When a man makes a vow according to your proper value of persons to Yahweh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if your proper value is for a male from twenty years of age up to sixty years of age, then your proper value shall be fifty shekels of money according to the sanctuary’s shekel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if it is for a female, then your proper value shall be thirty shekels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if from five years of age up to twenty years of age, then your proper value shall be twenty shekels for the male and ten shekels for the female.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if from a month of age up to five years of age, then your proper value shall be five shekels of money for the male, and your proper value for the female shall be three shekels of money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if from sixty years of age and above: if a male, then your proper value shall be fifteen shekels; and for the female, ten shekels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he is poorer than your proper value, then he shall present himself before the priest, and the priest shall set a value on him; the priest shall value him according to what the person who made a vow can afford.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And if it is a domestic animal from which they present an offering for Yahweh, all that he gives from it for Yahweh shall be a holy object.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall not replace it, nor shall he exchange it, either good with bad or bad with good; and if he indeed exchanges a domestic animal with a domestic animal, then it and its substitution shall be a holy object.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if it is any unclean animal from which they may not present an offering for Yahweh, then he shall present the animal before the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest shall set a value on it, either good or bad; as the priest sets your proper value, so it shall be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he indeed wants to redeem it, then he shall add a fifth of it onto your proper value.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And if a man consecrates his house as a holy object for Yahweh, then the priest shall set a value on it, either good or bad; just as the priest sets a value on it, so it shall remain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the one who consecrates it wants to redeem his house, then he shall add a fifth of your proper value’s money onto it, and it shall be his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And if a man consecrates some of his property’s fields for Yahweh, then your proper value shall be in accordance with its seed requirements: a homer of barley seed for fifty shekels of money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he consecrates his field from the Year of Jubilee, it shall stand as your proper value.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he consecrates his field after the Jubilee, then the priest shall calculate the money for him according to the number of years that are left over until the Year of Jubilee; and it shall be deducted from your proper value.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he indeed redeems the field that is consecrated, then he shall add a fifth of your proper value’s money onto it, and it shall stand for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he does not redeem the field and if he sells the field to another man, it may not be redeemed again,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the field shall be a holy object for Yahweh when it goes out in the Jubilee, like a devoted field; it shall be the priest’s property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And if he consecrates for Yahweh his acquired field that is not the field of his inherited possession,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the priest shall calculate for him the amount of your proper value until the year of the Jubilee, and he shall give your proper value on that day as a holy object for Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the Year of the Jubilee the field shall return to the one who bought it from him, to the one whose property the land is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And every proper value of yours shall be in the sanctuary’s shekel—the shekel shall be twenty gerahs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘However, a man shall not consecrate a firstborn among livestock, which belongs as firstborn to Yahweh; whether an ox or small livestock, it is for Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if it is among the unclean animals, then he shall ransom it according to your proper value, and he shall add a fifth of its value onto it; and if it is not redeemed, then it shall be sold according to your proper value.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, anything devoted that a man has devoted to Yahweh from all that he has, from human or animal, or from the field of his property, may not be sold, and it may not be redeemed; anything devoted is a most holy thing for Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone devoted who is devoted from human beings cannot be ransomed—he shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And any tithe of the land from the land’s seed or from the fruit of the trees is for Yahweh; it is a holy object for Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if a man indeed redeems from his tithe, he shall add a fifth of its value onto it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for every tithe of cattle or of the flock, all which crosses under the rod, the tenth shall be a holy object for Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall not inspect between the good and the bad, and he shall not exchange it; but if he indeed exchanges it, then it and its substitution shall be a holy object—it shall not be redeemed.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the commands that Yahweh commanded Moses for the Israelites on Mount Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator
